body:
@gchanan that was exactly what I was going to propose, but I was afraid it would be a bit too much work if we wanted to keep things similar to numpy.
In general, there has been a [lot of demand for a numpy-like api](https://github.com/pytorch/pytorch/issues/2228), and passing a `dtype` is definitely something we would like to have. Now, do we want it to be named as `tensor` or `array`? `array` would be a much more numpy-friendly name, and might make the transition from numpy to pytorch much easier.
